## Remarks A hash code is a numeric value that is used to identify an object during equality testing. It can also serve as an index for an object in a collection.
The <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.GetHashCode%2A> method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxAge As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> MaxAge { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };
member this.MaxAge : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: The maximum age, specified in seconds, that the HTTP client is willing to accept a response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the "max-age" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request or HTTP response.
Unless the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStale%2A> property is also set, the client is not willing to accept a stale response.

member this.MaxStale : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether an HTTP client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its expiration time.
Docs.value: if the HTTP client is willing to accept a response that has exceed the expiration time; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents if the "max-stale" directive is present in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxStaleLimit As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> MaxStaleLimit { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };
member this.MaxStaleLimit : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: The maximum time, in seconds, an HTTP client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its expiration time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the value assigned to "max-stale" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request.
If the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStaleLimit%2A> property is assigned a value other than zero, then the client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its expiration time by no more than the specified number of seconds. If a value of zero is assigned to the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStaleLimit%2A> property, then the client is willing to accept a stale response of any age.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MinFresh As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> MinFresh { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };
member this.MinFresh : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: The freshness lifetime, in seconds, that an HTTP client is willing to accept a response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the "min-fresh" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request.
The property indicates that the HTTP client is willing to accept a response whose freshness lifetime is no less than its current age plus the freshness lifetime specified time in seconds. The client wants a response that will still be fresh for at least the current age plus the freshness lifetime.

Docs.value: if the origin server requires revalidation of a cache entry on any subsequent use when the entry becomes stale; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents the "must-revalidate" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP response.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoCache { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.NoCache : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether an HTTP client is willing to accept a cached response.
Docs.value: if the HTTP client is not willing to accept a cached response; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the "no-cache" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request or HTTP response.
When the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoCache%2A> property is set to `true` present in a HTTP request message, an application should forward the request toward the origin server even if it has a cached copy of what is being requested.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NoCacheHeaders As ICollection(Of String)

Docs.summary: A collection of fieldnames in the "no-cache" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents fieldnames in the "no-cache" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP response.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoStore { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.NoStore : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether a cache must not store any part of either the HTTP request message or any response.
Docs.value: if a cache must not store any part of either the HTTP request message or any response; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the "no-store" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request or HTTP response.
The purpose of the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoStore%2A> property is to prevent the inadvertent release or retention of sensitive information. This property applies to the entire message, and may be sent either in an HTTP request or a response.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoTransform { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.NoTransform : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether a cache or proxy must not change any aspect of the entity-body.
Docs.value: if a cache or proxy must not change any aspect of the entity-body; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the "no-transform" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request or HTTP response.
When the <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoTransform%2A> is set to `true`, intermediate caches or proxies must not change any aspect of the entity body. Implementors of intermediate caches and proxies have found it useful to convert the media type of certain entity bodies. A non-transparent proxy might, for example, convert between image formats in order to save cache space or to reduce the amount of traffic on a slow link. Serious operational problems occur, however, when these transformations are applied to entity bodies intended for certain kinds of applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents the "only-if-cached" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP request.
